title: How the Latest Leaked Documents Are Different From Past Breaches
description: The freshness of the documents — some appear to be barely 40 days old — and the hints they hold for operations to come make them particularly damaging, officials say.

title: Leaked Documents Suggest Ukrainian Air Defense Is in Peril if Not Reinforced
description: A huge influx of munitions is needed to keep Russia’s air force from changing the course of the war, according to U.S. officials and newly leaked Pentagon documents.

title: Your Monday Briefing: Leaked U.S. Intelligence
description: Also, China conducts drills near Taiwan and the World Bank prepares for changes.

title: Europe Has Pledged a Million Shells for Ukraine in a Year. Can It Deliver?
description: Probably not, experts say, given the shrunken state of its military industrial sector. A look at a major munitions maker helps explain why.

title: Leaked Pentagon Documents Reveal Secrets About Friends and Foes
Ireland Readies a Warm Welcome for Biden, ‘the Most Irish’ President Since J.F.K.
description: Ahead of President Biden’s trip to Ireland, the locals of two towns, including several of his relatives, are hoping he’ll return to celebrate their ancestral ties.

title: Russia Plans Bounties on New Western Tanks, Leaked Documents Say
description: Unconfirmed reports from leaked Pentagon documents show plans to shore up troops’ morale and sharpen their tactics as Ukraine takes delivery of more advanced weapons.

title: El Salvador Decimated Its Ruthless Gangs. But at What Cost?
description: In the year since El Salvador declared a state of emergency, the government has delivered a stunning blow to the gangs that were once the ultimate authority in much of the country.

title: Canadian Police Technique Under Fire for Breeding False Confessions
description: A con game that undercover police use to obtain confessions in Canada secures convictions, but opponents say it’s a breeding ground for false confessions.

title: Fight for Roads Into Bakhmut Has Hit a Stalemate, Ukraine Says
description: Even as Russian forces made some gains in the battered eastern city last week, Ukraine’s forces say they have thwarted Moscow’s efforts to sever supply lines. For now.

title: Tipping Confusion
description: Tipping norms haven’t kept up with delivery apps and changes in how people buy food.

title: Leaked Documents Show Seoul Torn Between U.S. Demands and Its Own Policy
description: The documents showed the United States most likely spied on a key Asian ally as pressure built for South Korea to help Washington supply ammunition to Ukraine.

title: India’s Tigers Are Making a Comeback
description: A conservation effort has worked well enough that there is now talk of sending some tigers to Cambodia to help that nation revive its own wild population.

title: The World Bank Is Getting a New Chief. Will He Pivot Toward Climate Action?
description: Under pressure from world leaders, development experts and shareholders, the bank opens its spring meeting on Monday, poised for big changes.

title: U.S. Sends Attack Submarine to Middle East
description: Officials said the move was meant as a deterrent against Iran and to maintain the stability of one of the world’s busiest shipping lanes.
